golem.matrix

Interface MatrixFactory<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DoubleFactoryBase, EJMLMatrixFactory, JBlasMatrixFactory, MTJMatrixFactory

    public MatrixFactory<T>

    A set of constructors that must be implemented by a golem backend. Generates various types of matrices. Generic parameter is a type of matrix, i.e. T=Matrix or T=Matrix, etc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T arange(double start, double stop, double increment)
      Creates a row-vector with the first value of start and the last value of stop, with increment steps between each value.
      T arange(double start, double stop)
      Creates a row-vector with the first value of start and the last value of stop, with unit steps between each value.
      T arange(int start, int stop, int increment)
      Creates a row-vector with the first value of start and the last value of stop, with increment steps between each value.
      T arange(int start, int stop)
      Creates a row-vector with the first value of start and the last value of stop, with unit steps between each value.
      T create(kotlin.ranges.IntRange data)
      Creates a row-vector with initial values pulled from an int range, e.g. 1..45
      T create(double[] data)
      Creates a row-vector with initial values pulled from an double array
      T create(double[] data)
      Creates a matrix from an array of arrays (row-major)
      T eye(int size)
      Creates an identity matrix of the requested shape
      T eye(int rows, int cols)
      Creates an identity matrix of the requested shape, with zero padding if the axis lengths arent equal.
      T ones(int size)
      Creates a one initialized square matrix of the requested shape
      T ones(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a one initialized matrix of the requested shape
      T rand(int size)
      Creates a vector of size many uniform 0-1 random samples
      T rand(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a matrix of uniform 0-1 random samples
      T rand(int rows, int cols, long seed)
      Creates a matrix of rows x cols uniform 0-1 samples using the given seed. Two calls with the same seed will produce identical matrices
      T randn(int size)
      Creates a vector of size many unit-normal random samples
      T randn(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a matrix of unit-normal random samples
      T randn(int rows, int cols, long seed)
      Creates a matrix of rows x cols random samples using the given seed. Two calls with the same seed will produce identical matrices
      T zeros(int rows, int cols)
      Generate a zero initialized matrix of the requested shape.
      T zeros(int size)
      Generate a zero initialized square matrix of the requested shape.
